Articles.Content: [@LEGIONBOSS](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/139013-legionboss/) FINAL just means that the <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr> patch is applied at the end of loading. To get it to apply to these modules you would need to add another patch for the FlexoTube modules. And there are a lot of unused customization fields for docking ports, so I don't really know what each one does, there might be documentation out there somewhere.
Flexible docking ports can only by deployed and retract when not docked. Why is that? I was hoping that I can pull a vessel in closer when docked.

[@Kolago](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/103729-kolago/) Any kind of flexible, or movable joint is way beyond the scope of that mod. It's really complicated to move parts when they are already joined together, that's basically what Infernal Robotics does, and it is a very complex mod.
Ok, was just wondering.

Any plans for science relay to update to 1.4?

doesnt appear to be functional

>

> Any plans for science relay to update to 1.4?
> 
> 
> 
> 
> doesnt appear to be functional
> 

Of course there is a chance.. what is needed is patience. A lot of modders are not updating to 1.4 as 1.4.1 is days away... also be mindful of the fact that  the forum rule about asking modders about updates is back.

> Of course there is a chance.. what is needed is patience. A lot of modders are not updating to 1.4 as 1.4.1 is days away... also be mindful of the fact that  the forum rule about asking modders about updates is back.

Right sorry, havent been by in a while.

just wanted to make sure this was getting continued seeing as its so useful.

Updates for all of these mods are available, see the first post for links. They are all basically recompiles and updates for the AVC .version file and <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr>. Otherwise they are unchanged from the previous versions.
OneWindow: How about adding tool tips to the UI buttons?

[@Gordon Dry](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/163177-gordon-dry/) Tooltips are a surprisingly complicated thing to add to this type of UI. I figure the buttons are few enough and simple enough that their purpose can be divined by just clicking on them a few times.
Well, it's not that bad, just for new users it could be an issue.

Science Relay 5.1 is out; get it on [Space Dock](https://spacedock.info/mod/988/Science%20Relay).

It fixes a bug that occurs when trying to connect to certain types of vessels.

EVA Transfer V8.0

Not showing in game?

Check your KSP Log for the following error

[LOG 21:40:26.931] PartLoader: Compiling Part 'EVATransfer/EVAFuelLine/EVAFuelLine/EVAfuelLine'  

[ERR 21:40:26.934] PartCompiler: Cannot clone model 'Squad/Parts/CompoundParts/fuelLine/model' as model does not exist

To fix edit the "GameData\EVATransfer\EVAFuelLine\EVAFuelLine.cfg file and change the spelling of "fuelLine" to "FuelLine" (2 occurances, consecutive lines)

MODEL  

    {  

        model = Squad/Parts/CompoundParts/FuelLine/model  

        texture = model000, Squad/Parts/CompoundParts/FuelLine/model000   

    }

I've been looking all over the place in the KSP folder to find out where to change the science multipliers for different bodies only to find out DMagic knew what I was looking for for all this time!

One note though.. Line 3 in ScienceParamModifierConfig.cfg refers to "body**Defalt**Configs". Minor nitpick, but I love it when code is nice and tidy :).

[@Agnemon](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/163804-agnemon/) This is on Linux correct? Or does it happen in OSX, too? I've reported it as a bug that the directory names are not consistent.

[@Jognt](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/176871-jognt/) I think I noticed that a long time ago, but didn't want to change it as it might screw up existing configs. But yes, it bugs me, too.
Sry, no. Win10

[@Agnemon](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/163804-agnemon/) Where did you download it from, Steam? Or some other store. There must be some version of the build with a slightly different directory structure.

Trying to think (not an easy task with a brain like mine ) definetely wasn't steam, either spacedock  or curse.

I also should get in the habit of directing posts at people.

 [@DMagic](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/57416-dmagic/)
[@Agnemon](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/163804-agnemon/) I mean where did you download KSP from?
[@DMagic](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/57416-dmagic/)KSP Store.

I came here to report the same problem with EVA Transfer as Agnemon. Windows 10, also using KSP 1.4.1 downloaded as a ZIP from the KSP Store. Their fix worked for me as well. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")
Same problem for me with EVA Transfer. I opened a ticket on Github.

Can someone here with this problem make a ticket on the regular bug tracker? Having it reported on the public tracker, might be helpful.

[https://bugs.kerbalspaceprogram.com/](https://bugs.kerbalspaceprogram.com/)

The folder structure from the Steam version is:

Squad/Parts/CompoundParts/fuelLine

So if you can confirm that the KSP store version is different then just post that to the tracker.

Also, if someone could maybe take screenshots from the KSP store version of the fully expanded like this:

![DOhPbN2.png](https://i.imgur.com/DOhPbN2.png)

Obviously it would take a few images, but that might help in finding any other discrepancies.

> Squad/Parts/CompoundParts/fuelLine

Just as a quick note, the GOG version seems to match the Steam version, at least on this part.

KSP Store version is definitely "Squad\Parts\CompoundParts\FuelLine"

Win 10

KSP 1.4.1 (KSP Store )
